verses.translation: My dear Arjuna, only by undivided devotional service can I be understood as I am, standing before you, and can thus be seen directly. Only in this way can you enter into the mysteries of My understanding.
verses.teaching: The cosmic vision of God can only be truly understood and experienced through pure, undivided devotion. Intellectual understanding alone is insufficient for divine realization.

verses.sanskrit: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित्। अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः॥
verses.transliteration: tulya-nindā-stutir maunī santuṣṭo yena kenacit | aniketaḥ sthira-matir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ ||
verses.translation: One who is equal in honor and dishonor, who is steady, satisfied with anything, without a fixed residence, fixed in knowledge, and engaged in devotional service—such a person is very dear to Me.
verses.teaching: The qualities of a true devotee include equanimity in praise and criticism, contentment with whatever comes, detachment from material possessions, and steady devotion regardless of circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा। भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्॥
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-kṣetrajñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-cakṣuṣā | bhūta-prakṛti-mokṣaṁ ca ye vidur yānti te param ||
verses.translation: Those who see with eyes of knowledge the difference between the field and the knower of the field, and can also understand the process of liberation from material nature, attain the Supreme.
verses.teaching: True knowledge lies in understanding the distinction between the body (field) and the soul (knower of the field). This realization of our spiritual identity leads to liberation from material bondage.

verses.sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते। स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
verses.transliteration: māṁ ca yo 'vyabhicāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevate | sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate ||
verses.translation: One who engages in full devotional service, unfailing in all circumstances, at once transcends the modes of material nature and thus comes to the level of Brahman.
verses.teaching: Unwavering devotional service transcends the three modes of material nature (goodness, passion, ignorance) and elevates one to the spiritual platform of Brahman realization.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च। वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम्॥
verses.transliteration: sarvasya cāhaṁ hṛdi sanniviṣṭo mattaḥ smṛtir jñānam apohanaṁ ca | vedaiś ca sarvair aham eva vedyo vedānta-kṛd veda-vid eva cāham ||
verses.translation: I am seated in everyone's heart, and from Me come remembrance, knowledge and forgetfulness. By all the Vedas, I am to be known. Indeed, I am the compiler of Vedanta, and I am the knower of the Vedas.
verses.teaching: The divine presence within all beings is the source of consciousness, memory, and knowledge. All spiritual knowledge ultimately leads to understanding this inner divine presence as our true guide.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः। कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्॥
verses.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśanam ātmanaḥ | kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet ||
verses.translation: There are three gates leading to this hell—lust, anger and greed. Every sane man should give these up, for they lead to the degradation of the soul.
verses.teaching: Lust, anger, and greed are the three primary enemies of spiritual progress. They are the gateways to spiritual destruction and must be consciously abandoned for inner peace and growth.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा। सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca | tri-vidhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jā | sāttvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṁ śṛṇu ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: According to the modes of nature acquired by the embodied soul, one's faith can be of three kinds—in the mode of goodness, the mode of passion, or the mode of ignorance. Now hear about this.
verses.teaching: Faith itself is influenced by the three modes of material nature. Understanding the quality of our faith helps us purify our consciousness and elevate our spiritual practice toward higher modes.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śaraṇaṁ vraja | ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ ||
verses.translation: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.
verses.teaching: The ultimate teaching of surrender and divine grace. Complete trust in the divine removes all fear and suffering, offering the simplest and most direct path to liberation.
